similarity: The type of similarity algorithm to be used when scoring and ranking the documents matching a search query. The similarity algorithm can only be defined at index creation time and cannot be modified on existing indexes. If null, the ClassicSimilarity algorithm is used.
algorithm: Select which similarity algorithm to use for scoring and ranking.
odataType: OData type discriminator for the similarity object.
b: Controls how the length of a document affects the relevance score. Default is 0.75. 0.0 means no length normalization; 1.0 means fully normalized by length.
k1: Controls term frequency saturation. Default is 1.2. 0.0 means the score does not scale with an increase in term frequency.
immutability: Similarity can only be defined at index creation time; attempts to change it on an existing index may be rejected by the service.
